result.execSummary:
The defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, costs, surcharges and disbursements.  To be taken by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other senence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with Telia E. or Destiny W.
No  contact with Bank Mutual at 4812 W. Burleigh Street, Milwaukee, WI.
AODA assessment and treatment.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously provided, pay surcharge.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearm sor body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING AND ARRAIGNMENT  (17 pages) commencing MAY 12, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of the State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:David Anderson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and the Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TELIA E., DESTINY W. AND BANK MUTUAL, 4812 W BURLEIGH ST.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Keyuntra Montrell Spears in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
